title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.4 - Executive order no. 4: continuing the commission for the study of youth crime and violence and reform of the juvenile justice system
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.4 - Executive order no. 4: continuing the commission for the study of youth crime and violence and reform of the juvenile justice system

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the Commission for the Study of Youth Crime and

Violence and Reform of the Juvenile Justice System was established by Executive

Order No. 177 dated November 22, 1993; WHEREAS, the Commission has provided good cause as to why
the completion of its investigation was not possible by December 31, 1994; WHEREAS, it is important that the Commission have the
opportunity to examine, evaluate and make recommendations involving youth crime
and the Juvenile Justice System; and
WHEREAS, it is in the best interest of the State that the
findings and recommendations of the Commission be thorough and complete; NOW, THEREFORE, I, George E. Pataki, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Laws of the State of New York, do hereby continue from and after January 1, 1995, Executive Order No. 177 dated November 22, 1993, except that such

Executive Order is amended to read as follows: I. Membership

Andrew J. Stein is hereby designated Chairman of the

Commission, and the Director of the Division for Youth and Colleen McMahon are
designated as Vice Chairpersons of the Commission. The Commission shall consist
of an additional thirteen members, who were previously appointed to the

Commission. The members of the Commission shall receive no compensation but
shall be entitled to reimbursement for any necessary expenses incurred in
connection with the performance of their duties. Service on the Commission
shall not constitute public employment for purposes of disqualification from
holding of public office or employment. II. Report

The Commission shall prepare a written report to the

Governor assessing the problems associated with youth crime and violence and
the juvenile justice system of the State of New York and make appropriate
legislative, programmatic and administrative recommendations for improvement. A
final report shall be submitted to the Governor by March 31, 1995. The

Commission may issue any interim reports to the Governor and Legislature prior
to March 31, 1995 as it deems appropriate. *Continues and amends Executive Order No. 177 (Mario M. Cuomo), ยง
177.1, supra. Signed: George E. PatakiDated: January 10, 1995
[FN*] [Revoked and superseded by Executive Order No. 5.1, infra.]
